Optimize for 10+ players: throttle + buffer limits

Performance Optimizations:
1. Throttle WebSocket broadcasts to 30 FPS \(server.js:2282-2298\)
   - Game loop still runs at 60 FPS for physics accuracy
   - Broadcasts only send every 33ms \(30 FPS\)
   - Reduces network traffic by 50% for 10+ player rooms
   - Adds ~16ms latency but prevents connection overload

2. Increase WebSocket buffer limits \(server.js:57-62\)
   - maxPayload: 100MB \(prevent message size errors\)
   - perMessageDeflate: false \(better performance, less CPU\)
   - Prevents buffer overflow with many simultaneous clients

Expected Results:
- Fewer disconnects/crashes with 10 players
- Lower bandwidth usage \(60 ‚Üí 30 updates/sec\)
- Minimal impact on gameplay responsiveness
- More stable connections under high load

Bump version to 3.17.8

Add Ballz game - multiplayer physics-based arcade

New Game Features:
- Max 3 players simultaneously with synchronized levels \(seeded RNG\)
- Physics-based ball shooting with simplified reflection mechanics
- Turn-based gameplay with charging system
- Block HP progression that increases over time
- Bonus ball pickups for accumulating more balls
- Dead zone mechanic \(blocks firing at extreme tilt angles\)
- Aim sensitivity controls for charge stability
- Individual player fields with split-screen layout
- Game over cards and final leaderboard display

Client \(index.html + display.html\):
- Added Ballz button to game selection screen
- Added comprehensive settings form with 11 parameters:
  * Field size \(5-9 width, 8-14 height\)
  * HP progression \(every 3-10 turns\)
  * Max block HP \(30-100\)
  * Lower HP chance \(0-50%\)
  * Dead zone size \(0-15%\)
  * Charge time \(1-5 seconds\)
  * Aim sensitivity \(very high to very low\)
  * Ball speed \(slow to very fast\)
  * Launch delay \(50-150ms\)
  * Bonus spawn rate \(5-25%\)
- Settings saved to localStorage
- Multi-screen rendering:
  * 1 player: full screen
  * 2 players: vertical split
  * 3 players: three columns
- Game over cards for eliminated players
- Final leaderboard with ranking by score then turns
- Charge visualization with gradient fill and pulsing indicator
- Dead zone visual feedback \(red "BLOCKED" indicator\)
- Block rendering with HP bars and dynamic colors
- Bonus ball glow effects

Server \(server.js\):
- Created seeded RNG for synchronized block spawning
- Room initialization with all game parameters
- Player initialization with independent field state
- State machine implementation:
  * AIMING: Convert tilt to aim angle, check dead zones
  * CHARGING: Track charge progress, reset on movement
  * LAUNCHING: Sequential ball launches with delays
  * BALLS_IN_FLIGHT: Physics updates and collision detection
  * TURN_COMPLETE: Block descent, spawning, game over check
- Physics engine with wall bounces and simplified reflections
- AABB circle-to-rectangle collision detection
- Block management with seeded spawning for synchronization
- HP calculation formula with lower HP chances
- Victory condition checking with leaderboard generation
- Serialization of all player-specific state
- Max 3 player room limit enforcement

Technical Highlights:
- Seeded RNG ensures all players see identical block patterns
- Dead zone logic prevents shooting at extreme angles
- Charge sensitivity configurable for different difficulty levels
- Turn-based asynchronous gameplay \(players progress independently\)
- Emergency 60-second timeout for stuck balls
- Blocks Map converted to Array for efficient serialization

Bash(git -C "c:\\Users\\dimsh\\Downloads\\Pong-test" commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF'' Fix duplicate QR codes - 7th attempt, final solution \(v3.24.4\) Root Cause Analysis \(from v3.5 comparison\): - In v3.5 \(late December\): ONE QR code with id="qrcode", worked perfectly - Current version: TWO QR codes \(waitingQRCode + persistentQRDisplay\) - Previous 6 fix attempts used flags to prevent duplicate generation - REAL problem: QRCode library APPENDS elements, doesn''t replace them! Why Previous Fixes Failed: - Attempts 1-5: Used while loop or flags to "prevent" duplicates - Attempt 6: Added innerHTML = '''' but INSIDE flag check - If room_created fires twice OR flag logic fails ‚Üí duplicates appear - Flag approach fundamentally flawed - library always appends Final Solution: - ALWAYS clear container with innerHTML = '''' BEFORE generating - Removed ALL flag checks \(waitingQRCodeGenerated\) - Removed flag reset logic - Simple approach: clear ‚Üí generate, every time Technical Details: - QRCode library creates both AND elements - Multiple calls = multiple canvas + multiple img = multiple QR codes - innerHTML = '''' clears ALL children, preventing accumulation - No flags needed - let library work, just clear first Verified Against v3.5: - v3.5 used: getElementById\(''qrcode''\).innerHTML = ''''; then new QRCode\(\) - Same pattern, worked for months without issues - Current fix restores this proven approach Bump version to 3.24.4 ü§ñ Generated with [Claude Code]\(https://claude.com/claude-code\) Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 EOF \)")

Split CSS rule into two separate rules \(display.html:390-401\): - #waitingQRCode img { display: block !important; } - #waitingQRCode canvas { display: none !important; } 2. Fix Ballz critical bugs - shooting and bonus freeze \(v3.25.6\)

CRITICAL BUG FIXES:

1. Fix shooting with static phone \(SOLVED\):
   - Root cause: Strict equality check `player.tilt !== player.lastTilt`
     treated ANY micro-vibration \(even 0.0001% change\) as "movement"
   - Even phones lying completely still have sensor noise
   - Solution: Threshold-based comparison \(server.js:4177-4185\)
     * Changed to: `Math.abs\(player.tilt - player.lastTilt\) >= room.aimSensitivity`
     * Now ignores micro-fluctuations below 0.5% \(adjustable\)
   - Result: Shots now work with static phones!

2. Fix game freeze after collecting bonus ball \(SOLVED\):
   - Root cause: Turn completion check compared wrong values \(server.js:4352\)
     * Compared `balls.length` \(balls launched THIS turn\)
     * With `ballCount` \(balls to launch NEXT turn\)
     * When bonus collected mid-turn: `ballCount++` but `balls.length` unchanged
     * Comparison `balls.length === ballCount` never true ‚Üí infinite hang
   - Solution: Track ball count at turn start
     * Added `player.ballsThisTurn = player.ballCount` at charge completion \(line 4193\)
     * Initialize `player.ballsThisTurn = 1` on player join \(line 2218\)
     * Changed comparison to use `ballsThisTurn` instead \(line 4352\)
   - Result: Game now continues correctly after bonus collection!

VISUAL IMPROVEMENTS \(display.html:3808-3848\):

3. Aim line 3x longer \(200px ‚Üí 600px\):
   - Line now reaches walls as requested
   - Better trajectory preview

4. Simplified aim line animation:
   - Removed choppy pulsing dots animation
   - Replaced with simple static dotted line
   - Cleaner, more predictable visual

Technical Details:
- Digital stabilization filters sensor noise below aimSensitivity threshold
- ballsThisTurn captures count before mid-turn bonus modifications
- Prevents race condition between ball launch count and bonus collection

Bash(git -C "c:\\Users\\dimsh\\Downloads\\Pong-test" commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Fix Snake critical issues - jerky turning, replay freeze, zombie snakes \(v3.25.12\)

CRITICAL FIXES:

1. ‚úÖ Fix jerky turning at 0.9-1.0 tilt range \(FINALLY SOLVED\):
   - Root cause: 30% overflow allowance \(-0.3 to 1.3\) created discontinuous jumps
     * When tilt crossed calibration boundary: 0.95 ‚Üí 1.0 ‚Üí 1.05 ‚Üí 1.1
     * For arrow modes: multiplied by 2œÄ causing 36¬∞ instant rotation jumps
     * For rotation modes: tiltDeviation jumps amplified by rotation speed
   - Solution: Exponential smoothing filter
     * Added player.smoothedTilt field \(server.js:2163\)
     * Applied smoothing on input: 30% new, 70% old \(server.js:2381-2388\)
     * Used smoothedTilt in all Snake control calculations \(server.js:3019, 3112, 3134\)
   - Result: Smooth amplitude changes matching phone movement, no more jerks!

2. ‚úÖ Fix game freeze when eating last star on replay \(100% reproducible\):
   - Root cause: respawnCountdown not cleared on replay
     * Player died in first game ‚Üí respawnCountdown = 3.0
     * User clicked "play again" ‚Üí resetSnakeGame\(\) ran
     * resetSnakeGame\(\) set player.alive = true BUT didn''t clear respawnCountdown
     * On second game, respawn logic in inconsistent state ‚Üí freeze
   - Solution: Clear respawn state on replay \(server.js:505-506\)
     * player.respawnCountdown = undefined
     * player.respawnPosition = undefined
   - Result: No more freeze on second game!

3. ‚úÖ Fix zombie snakes - disconnected players \(critical UX issue\):
   - Root cause: Player kept in room for reconnection but snake kept moving
     * Disconnect handler preserved player for 60s grace period
     * player.ws = null but player.alive still true
     * Snake continued moving straight as "zombie"
   - Solution: Kill snake on disconnect for Snake game \(server.js:2725-2730\)
     * player.alive = false
     * player.segments = [] \(clear from display\)
   - Result: Disconnected snakes instantly disappear!

Technical Details:
- Smoothing factor: 0.3 \(tuned for responsiveness vs stability\)
- Smoothing applies to ALL control schemes \(rotation, arrow, etc\)
- Raw tilt still stored in player.tilt for reference

Bash(git -C "c:\\Users\\dimsh\\Downloads\\Pong-test" commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Fix Snake head-to-head collision bug \(v3.25.15\)

CRITICAL BUG FIX:

Root Cause:
- Collision detection loop checked ALL segments starting from i=0
- Segment[0] is the OTHER player''s HEAD
- When two heads collided, BOTH snakes detected collision
- Race condition caused wrong snake to die
- User reported: "—É–º–µ—Ä–ª–∞ —Ç–∞ –∑–º–µ–π–∫–∞ –≤ –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—É—é –≤—Ä–µ–∑–∞–ª–∏—Å—å, –∞ –Ω–µ —Ç–∞, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–∞—è –≤—Ä–µ–∑–∞–ª–∞—Å—å"

Solution:
- Changed collision loop to start from i=1 instead of i=0 \(server.js:3904\)
- Now only checks BODY segments \(skips head at index 0\)
- Head-to-head collisions no longer trigger death
- Only head-into-body collisions cause death

Technical Details:
- Old: for \(let i = 0; i < otherPlayer.segments.length; i++\)
- New: for \(let i = 1; i < otherPlayer.segments.length; i++\)
- Added debug logging: [COLLISION] with segment index and player names
- Follows classic Snake mechanics: head can only die by hitting body

This aligns with traditional Snake game rules where head-to-head
meetings don''t cause death, only head-into-body collisions.
